author: Larry Rubama
title: All-Tidewater 2014 | Softball
text:
ALL-TIDEWATER FIRST TEAM PLAYER OF THE YEAR
SYDNEY HARLESS , Great Bridge, Junior pitcher
Helped lead the Wildcats to the Group 5A state title. Finished 26-1 with 0.14 ERA and 202 strikeouts. Threw 16 shutouts. Two-time All-Tidewater selection. Group 5A Co-South Region and PenSouth Conference Pitcher of the Year. Read more about Sydney Harless
____
DELANEY AMBROSE , Great Bridge, Senior infielder
Batted .516 with 22 RBIs and five homers for the Group 5A state champion and a team that won PenSouth Conference regular-season and tournament titles. First-team All-South Region and All-PenSouth Conference. Second-team All-Tidewater as a junior. ____
MEAGHAN BARFIELD , First Colonial, Sophomore infielder
Batted .514 with 38 RBIs, 29 runs and 12 homers. Helped lead the Patriots to the Coastal Conference regular-season and tournament titles. First-team All-Coastal Conference. ____
KATELYN BIANDO , Nansemond River, Freshman utility
Played right field, second base, pitcher and catcher. Batted .577 with 23 RBIs and 19 runs to help the Warriors win Group 4A South Region. Had a 23-game hitting streak. First-team All-South Region and first-team All-Ironclad Conference. ____
CHLOE CARR , Great Bridge, Senior infielder
Batted .459 with 24 RBIs and nine doubles. Two-time All-Tidewater selection. Helped lead the Wildcats to the Group 5A state title and PenSouth Conference regular-season and tournament titles. First-team All-South Region and All-PenSouth Conference. ____
LAUREN DUFF , Hickory, Senior catcher
PenSouth Conference Player of the Year. Batted .547 with 41 hits and a .610 on-base percentage. Two-time All-Tidewater selection. “A true five-tool athlete, fast, strong and the best arm I’ve ever seen.” Hickory coach Ryan Wieck. ____
KAYLA HARRIS , Greenbrier Christian, Senior pitcher
Helped lead the Gators to a sixth consecutive VISAA state title. Batted .587 with 66 RBIs, 12 homers and nine doubles. VISAA Division II and Tidewater Conference Player of the Year. Finished 15-1 with nine shutouts, two no-hitters and a perfect game. Two-time All-Tidewater selection and the 2013 All-Tidewater Player of the Year. ____
SKYLAR JOHNSTON , First Colonial, Sophomore infielder
Batted .558 with 38 RBIs, 27 runs and eight homers. Helped lead the Patriots to the Coastal Conference regular-season and tournament titles. First-team All-Coastal Conference. ____
ANNA KALASINSKY , Princess Anne, Senior infielder
Batted .582 with 28 RBIs and a .642 on-base percentage. All-Group 5A South Region Player of the Year. Atlantic Conference Player of the Year. ____
MADISON KING , First Colonial, Senior infielder
Batted .416 with 37 runs, 32 RBIs and nine home runs. Helped lead First Colonial to the state tournament for the first time in school history. Coastal Conference Player of the Year. Two-time All-Tidewater selection. ____
LAUREN MADDREY , Nansemond River, Sophomore pitcher
Finished with a 1.47 ERA and more than 80 strikeouts to help the Warriors win the Group 4A South Region. Only regular-season loss was to Group 5A state champ Great Bridge. First-team All-South Region and All-Ironclad Conference. ____
JACLYN MOUNIE , Nansemond River, Sophomore infielder
Batted .519 with 26 runs and 18 RBIs to help the Warriors win the Group 4A South Region title. Ironclad Conference Player of the Year. First-team All-South Region. “She is the epitome of what Nansemond River softball is all about: Hard work.” Nansemond River coach Gabe Rogers. ____
CAMERYN STROTHER , Great Bridge, Junior outfielder
Batted .515 to help lead the Wildcats to the Group 5A state title and PenSouth Conference regular-season and tournament titles. First-team All-South Region and All-PenSouth Conference. ____
SECOND TEAM
Ryn Boelter , Deep Creek, sophomore pitcher
Makayla Fallejo , Kellam, junior infielder
Jessica Goldyn , Ocean Lakes, sophomore catcher
Katelynn Hodgkiss , Nansemond River, sophomore infielder
Sammy Jackson , Princess Anne, freshman pitcher
Kaitlyn Lehan , Ocean Lakes, senior pitcher
Shontel Linnette , Booker T. Washington, senior pitcher
Morgan Lowers , Nansemond River, junior outfielder
Claire Murphy , Hickory, senior outfielder
Jenna Powell , First Colonial, junior pitcher
Sydney Rupe , Great Bridge, senior catcher
Selena Thompson , Greenbrier Christian, junior infielder
Madison Wilson , Kellam, sophomore infielder
____
PILOT KEEPSAKES
